Class AnimalArrayListTest

java.lang.Object
AnimalArrayListTest
public class AnimalArrayListTest extends Object
Test Class for AnimalArrayList. Ensures that all functionality is working properly for AnimalArrayList objects.
Version:
02/10/2024
Author:
Jackson Eshbaugh

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    setUp()
    Called before each test is called.
    void
    tearDown()
    Called after each test is called.
    void
    testAdd()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.add(Animal) method: Adds a Fish to the list. Adds some Bears to the list. Tries to add null to the list.
    void
    testClear()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.clear() method: Tests an empty list. Tests a list with items (should have a size of 0 and accessing any item shouldn't work after clearing it)
    void
    testFind()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.find(Animal) method: Tries to find an Animal that's in the list. Tries to find an Animal that isn't in the list. Tries to find a null value in the list.
    void
    testGet()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.get(int) method: Tests an index too large for the list's boundaries. Tests an index too small for the list's boundaries. Tests an index within the list's boundaries. Tests an index at the beginning the list's boundary (i.e., 0). Tests an index at the end of the list's boundary (i.e., AnimalArrayList.size() - 1).
    void
    testRemoveAnimal()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.remove(Animal) method.
    void
    testRemoveIndex()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.remove(int) method.
    void
    testResize()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.resize(int) method: Grows an array by adding values and ensures that each value can still be added. Removes these values and ensures that each is removed.
    void
    testSize()
    Tests the AnimalArrayList.size() method: Verifies the size of a new list is 0. Checks the list size after adding items. Checks the list size after removing items.

      public AnimalArrayListTest()
      Creates a new AnimalArrayListTest object.

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Called before each test is called.

    • tearDown

      @AfterEach public void tearDown()
      Called after each test is called.

    • testAdd

      @Test @DisplayName("add(Animal)") public void testAdd()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.add(Animal) method:
      1. Adds a Fish to the list.
      2. Adds some Bears to the list.
      3. Tries to add null to the list.

    • testRemoveAnimal

      @Test @DisplayName("remove(Animal)") public void testRemoveAnimal()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.remove(Animal) method. From a prepared (pre-filled) list:
      1. Tries to remove an Animal that is in the list.
      2. Tries to remove an Animal that isn't in the list.
      3. Tries to remove null from the list.

    • testRemoveIndex

      @Test @DisplayName("remove(int)") public void testRemoveIndex()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.remove(int) method. From a prepared (pre-filled) list:
      1. Tries to remove a valid index from the list.
      2. Tries to remove an invalid index from the list.
      3. Tries to remove a negative index from the list.

    • testFind

      @Test @DisplayName("find(Animal)") public void testFind()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.find(Animal) method:
      1. Tries to find an Animal that's in the list.
      2. Tries to find an Animal that isn't in the list.
      3. Tries to find a null value in the list.

    • testSize

      @Test @DisplayName("size()") public void testSize()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.size() method:
      1. Verifies the size of a new list is 0.
      2. Checks the list size after adding items.
      3. Checks the list size after removing items.

    • testClear

      @Test @DisplayName("clear()") public void testClear()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.clear() method:
      1. Tests an empty list.
      2. Tests a list with items (should have a size of 0 and accessing any item shouldn't work after clearing it)

    • testGet

      @Test @DisplayName("get() Tests") public void testGet()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.get(int) method:
      1. Tests an index too large for the list's boundaries.
      2. Tests an index too small for the list's boundaries.
      3. Tests an index within the list's boundaries.
      4. Tests an index at the beginning the list's boundary (i.e., 0).
      5. Tests an index at the end of the list's boundary (i.e., AnimalArrayList.size() - 1).

    • testResize

      @Test @DisplayName("resize(int)") public void testResize()
      Tests the AnimalArrayList.resize(int) method:
      1. Grows an array by adding values and ensures that each value can still be added.
      2. Removes these values and ensures that each is removed.
